info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 02 at 10:43PM CST until March 02 at 11:45PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Little River County in southwestern Arkansas... Hempstead County in southwestern Arkansas... Northern Miller County in southwestern Arkansas... Northeastern Lafayette County in southwestern Arkansas... Nevada County in southwestern Arkansas... Northwestern Columbia County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until 1145 PM CST. * At 1043 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Crater Of Diamonds State Park to near Fulton to near Genoa, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Texarkana, Hope, Prescott, Stamps, Waldo, Lewisville, McNeil, Emmet, Blevins, Buckner, Perrytown, Rosston, Garland, Fulton, Washington, Willisville, Bodcaw, Bluff City, Genoa and White Oak Lake State Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for southwestern Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until midnight CST for southwestern Arkansas. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
